module.name: variant
module.description:
Schema for using genomic elements such as gene, chromosome, protein as extension on 'observ.xml'. Generic schema inspired by Chado. All other properties should already be covered in the core Pheno.xml model, in particular relationship which is in ObservedValue. Some extra may need to be added (e.g. dbXrefs, pubs, etc, for each ObservationElement).
There is a crucial difference between the Chado location model and the sequence location model used in other schemas, such as GFF, GenBank, BioSQL, or BioPerl. First, Chado is the only model to use the concept of rank and locgroup. Second, and perhaps more important, all these other models allow discontiguous locations (also known as "split locations").See http://gmod.org/wiki/Chado_Sequence_Module#Table:_feature

field.name: residues
field.description: A sequence of alphabetic characters representing biological residues (nucleic acids, amino acids). This column does not need to be manifested for all features; it is optional for features such as exons where the residues can be derived from the featureloc. It is recommended that the value for this column be manifested for features which may may non-contiguous sublocations (e.g. transcripts), since derivation at query time is non-trivial. For expressed sequence, the DNA sequence should be used rather than the RNA sequence.

field.name: seqlen
field.description: The length of the residue feature. See column:residues. This column is partially redundant with the residues column, and also with featureloc. This column is required because the location may be unknown and the residue sequence may not be manifested, yet it may be desirable to store and query the length of the feature. The seqlen should always be manifested where the length of the sequence is known.

field.name: gdna
field.description: The genome this element lies on.

field.name: cdna
field.description: The gene this element lies on.

field.name: aa
field.description: The protein sequence this element lies on.

field.name: aa_start
field.description: Start position on amino acid sequence.

field.name: aa_end
field.description: End position on amino acid sequence.

field.name: isAutosomal
field.description: Is 'yes' when number of chromosomes is equal in male and female individuals, i.e., if not a sex chromosome.

entity.name: Gene
entity.description: Serves as a view on SequenceCharacteristics that are genes / cdna

field.name: strand
field.description: The orientation/directionality of the location. Should be 0, -1 or +1.

entity.name: Protein
entity.description: Serves as a view on SequencesCharacteristics that are proteins / aa.

entity.name: ProteinDomain
entity.description: Serves as a view on SequenceCharacteristics that are protein domains.

entity.name: Exon
entity.description: Serves as a view on SequenceCharacteristics that are exons or introns.

field.name: isIntron
field.description: Is this exon actually an intron?

entity.name: Variant
entity.description: Convenient entity to define in one place variants on gdna, cdna and aa level.

field.name: gdna_notation
field.description: gDNA notation of the variant, e.g. g.1234567C>T

field.name: cdna_notation
field.description: cDNA notation of the variant, e.g. c.123C>T

field.name: aa_notation
field.description: Aa notation of the variant, e.g. p.Ser123ArgfsX12
